Dixt#

class lxdx.Dixt(data=None, /, **kwargs)#

Bases: collections.abc.MutableMapping

Dixt is an “extended” Python dict, works just like dict, but with metadata and attribute-accessibility by normalising keys.

New methods are incorporated, such as conversion from and to JSON, submap/supermap comparison, and others.

__init__(data=None, /, **kwargs)#

Initialise an empty object, or from another mapping object, sequence of key-value pairs, or keyword arguments.

Parameters

  • data – Can be an iterable of key-value pairs, a dict, another Dixt object

  • kwargs – Additional items which add or update (if there are same keys) data.

clear()#

Remove all items in this object.

contains(*keys, assert_all=True) → Union[bool, Tuple]#

Evaluate if all enumerated keys exist.

To preserve the behaviour of the operator in in Python mappings and sequences, this method will only accept non-normalised keys.

Parameters

  • keys – One or more non-normalised keys to evaluate existence of.

  • assert_all – If True (default), assert that all keys are found, returning a bool value. If False, return a tuple of boolean values corresponding to each key whether it is found or not.

dict() → Dict#

Convert this object to dict, with non-normalised keys.

static from_json(json_str, /)#

Convert a JSON string to a Dixt object.

get(*attrs, default=None) → Any#

Get the items from a sequence of attrs.

Parameters

  • attrs – One or more normalised or non-normalised keys to get items of.

  • default – Use as replacement value for all keys not found if set with a non-list/tuple value. If list or tuple, a one-to-one correspondence of values to attrs when not found.

Returns

A tuple of associated item of the attrs, replacing items of any key not found with the default.

Except when len(attrs) == 1, in which the method returns the actual item and not tuple.

Raises

ValueError – When len(default) != len(attrs), only when default is a list/tuple.

Similar method: setdefault().

get_from(path: str, /) → Any#

Get the item from the specified path of the key. Path is the ‘stringified’ attribute-style accessibility.

Parameters

path – The direction to the target item specified by $.<key>.{...}.<target-key>, where the required $ points to the object where this method is called. The series of keys must be the normalised keys.

Raises

  • TypeError, ValueError – Invalid path.

  • KeyError – Key is not found.

  • IndexError – Invalid list index.

Examples:
dixt.get_from('$.group.name')          # dixt.group.name
dixt.group.get_from('$.some.list[1]')  # dixt.group.some.list[1]

Note

  • Path is only evaluated for public attributes.

  • Only one (1) item can be accessed from any list. That is, no slicing.

is_submap_of(other: Union[Mapping, List[Tuple]]) → bool#

Evaluate if all of this object’s keys and values are contained and equal to the other’s, recursively. This is the opposite of is_supermap_of().

Parameters

other – Other dict, Dixt, or Mapping objects to compare to.

is_supermap_of(other: Union[Mapping, List[Tuple]]) → bool#

Evaluate if all the other object’s keys and values are contained and equal to this object’s, recursively. This is the opposite of is_submap_of().

Parameters

other – Other dict, Dixt, or Mapping objects to compare to.

items() → collections.abc.ItemsView#

Return a set-like object providing a view to this object’s key-value pairs.

json() → str#

Convert this object to JSON string.

keymeta(*keys, **flags)#

Add metadata to one or more keys. If no flags are specified, return all metadata for the keys.

Supported flags:
  • hidden (boolean)

    Hides the item from the output/result or processing of some methods and operators of Dixt. See separate documentation for more info.

Raises

KeyError – When any key is not found.

Note

Non-supported flags are silently bypassed.

keys() → collections.abc.KeysView#

Return a set-like object providing a view to this object’s keys.

pop(key, default=Ellipsis, /) → Any#

Get the value associated with the key, then remove the item.

The default value will be returned if key is not found.

Raises

KeyError – If attribute is not found and default value (other than Ellipsis) is not specified.

popitem() → tuple#

Returns a tuple of key-value pair. Since this function is inherited not from dict, LIFO is not guaranteed.

Raises

KeyError – If this object is empty.

reverse()#

Reverse the key-value map on the first layer items with hashable values. See hashable for more info.

Any item flagged as hidden will be excluded.

Raises

TypeError – If any value is non-hashable.

setdefault(key, default=None) → Any#

Get value associated with key. If key exists, return self[key]; otherwise, set self[key] = default then return default value.

Similar method: get().

update(other=(), /, **kwargs)#

Update this object from another Mapping objects (e.g., dict, Dixt), from an iterable key-value pairs, or through keyword arguments.

values() → collections.abc.ValuesView#

Return a set-like object providing a view to this object’s values.

whats_hidden() → tuple#

Get all keys that have the hidden metadata.

Returns

Tuple of non-normalised keys.
